name: One-handed kettlebell curls
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing in front of a mirror with your back straight and core engaged.

2. Hold one kettlebell by the handle, keeping your arm close to your side at a slight angle (about 45-degree).

3. Lift the kettlebell up towards your shoulder using only the muscles in your arm, keeping your upper arm still and only moving your forearm and hand.

4. Slowly lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position by releasing the contraction in your biceps.

5. Rest for 10-15 seconds between sets.

6. Repeat with the other arm.
short_summary: One-handed kettlebell curls are an isolation exercise that target the biceps, and can be performed using a single dumbbell.
